main event: On November 25, 1955, multiple individuals reported sighting an unidentified object near La Veta, Colorado, displaying characteristics such as a barrel shape, lemon yellow color surrounded by metallic blue, and maneuvering without making any sound or exhaust.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 7 seconds and the object was observed at an elevation of about 15,000 feet. The weather was described as CAVIE.

A senator reported seeing a barrel-shaped object approximately 50 to 60 feet long and about 15 to 20 feet in diameter, emitting a glow and a hum, maneuvering in flight, and suddenly disappearing from view.

The owners of Alpine Gate and Restaurant also reported observing an unidentified flying object on the same date, which did not leave any vapor trail as it moved and eventually disappeared over the horizon.
There were no clouds in the sky on the day of the sightings, and the object's behavior did not align with normal air travel.
The report was downgraded at 2-year intervals and declassified after 12 years, classified as UNCLASSIFIED at the time of its release.
witnesses: Sam T. Taylor, an honorable senator, Mr. and Mrs. owners of Alpine Gate and Restaurant
